meanings.definition: A hat worn by ancient Romans.
meanings.sent1: The pileus protected the head from the sun.
meanings.sent2: He placed the pileus on his head before going outside.
meanings.sent3: The pileus flew off in the wind, causing laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her pileus was a symbol of her Roman heritage.
meanings.sent5: The red pileus stood out in the crowd of people.

meanings.definition: The upper, umbrella-like part of a mushroom.
meanings.sent1: The pileus of the mushroom was wide and flat.
meanings.sent2: She carefully examined the pileus of the mushroom for signs of decay.
meanings.sent3: The pileus of the mushroom provided shade for the tiny creatures below.
meanings.sent4: The pileus of the mushroom resembled a colorful umbrella.
meanings.sent5: The pileus of the mushroom glistened in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A felt cap worn by ancient Greeks.
meanings.sent1: The pileus kept his head warm during the cold winter.
meanings.sent2: She admired the intricate design of the pileus worn by the ancient Greeks.
meanings.sent3: The pileus of the ancient Greek looked comically oversized on his head.
meanings.sent4: The pileus of the ancient Greek was a symbol of his status.
meanings.sent5: The soft pileus felt comfortable against her skin.
